dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5095 IH: Fostering Resource Efficiency in Education by Zero Employment Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bean of Florida (for himself, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, and Mr. Moran) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, and in addition to the Committee on Appropriations, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To freeze hiring activity for the Department of Education, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fostering Resource Efficiency in Education by Zero Employment Act or the FREEZE Act.

subsection.text: Beginning on the date of the enactment of this Actâ€”

paragraph.text: no individual may be appointed to any position within the Department of Education; and
no new position may be established at the Department of Education.

subsection.text: There is permanently rescinded, from the unobligated balance of all amounts appropriated or otherwise made available for the salaries and expenses of the Department of Education as of the date of the enactment of this Act, such sums as may be in excess of the amount required to cover the salary or expenses of each person employed by the Department as of such date of enactment.

subsection.header: Limitation on the use of funds
subsection.text: No Federal funds may be obligated or expended for the salary of any position or employee in violation of subsection (a).
